questions.question: Professor Tinkles is studying prime numbers. Which of these is prime: 15, 17, 21, 25?
questions.explanation: 17 is prime because it has no divisors other than 1 and itself. 15 = 3Ã—5, 21 = 3Ã—7, 25 = 5Ã—5!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth wants to find all factors of 12. How many factors does 12 have?
questions.explanation: The factors of 12 are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. That's 6 factors total!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington needs to find the GCD of 18 and 24. What is it?
questions.explanation: GCD(18, 24) = 6. The factors of 18 are 1,2,3,6,9,18 and of 24 are 1,2,3,4,6,8,12,24. The largest common factor is 6!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson is investigating the LCM of 4 and 6. What is it?
questions.explanation: LCM(4, 6) = 12. The multiples of 4 are 4,8,12,16... and of 6 are 6,12,18... The smallest common multiple is 12!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is checking if 156 is divisible by 3. What is the sum of its digits?
questions.explanation: Sum of digits: 1 + 5 + 6 = 12. Since 12 is divisible by 3, so is 156!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is studying prime numbers. Which is the smallest prime number greater than 20?
questions.explanation: 23 is prime. 21 = 3Ã—7, 22 = 2Ã—11, 25 = 5Ã—5, but 23 has no divisors other than 1 and 23!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington needs to find all factors of 20. How many factors does 20 have?
questions.explanation: The factors of 20 are: 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 20. That's 6 factors total!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson is investigating the GCD of 15 and 25. What is it?
questions.explanation: GCD(15, 25) = 5. The factors of 15 are 1,3,5,15 and of 25 are 1,5,25. The largest common factor is 5!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is calculating the LCM of 3 and 8. What is it?
questions.explanation: LCM(3, 8) = 24. The multiples of 3 are 3,6,9,12,15,18,21,24... and of 8 are 8,16,24... The smallest common multiple is 24!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is checking if 234 is divisible by 9. What is the sum of its digits?
questions.explanation: Sum of digits: 2 + 3 + 4 = 9. Since 9 is divisible by 9, so is 234!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is studying prime numbers. Which of these is NOT prime: 19, 23, 27, 29?
questions.explanation: 27 is not prime because 27 = 3Ã—9. 19, 23, and 29 are all prime numbers!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson needs to find all factors of 16. How many factors does 16 have?
questions.explanation: The factors of 16 are: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16. That's 5 factors total!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is investigating the GCD of 12 and 18. What is it?
questions.explanation: GCD(12, 18) = 6. The factors of 12 are 1,2,3,4,6,12 and of 18 are 1,2,3,6,9,18. The largest common factor is 6!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is calculating the LCM of 5 and 7. What is it?
questions.explanation: LCM(5, 7) = 35. The multiples of 5 are 5,10,15,20,25,30,35... and of 7 are 7,14,21,28,35... The smallest common multiple is 35!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington is checking if 315 is divisible by 5. What is the last digit?
questions.explanation: The last digit is 5. Since it ends in 5, 315 is divisible by 5!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is studying prime numbers. Which of these is prime: 21, 23, 25, 27?
questions.explanation: 23 is prime because it has no divisors other than 1 and itself. 21 = 3Ã—7, 25 = 5Ã—5, 27 = 3Ã—9!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth wants to find all factors of 18. How many factors does 18 have?
questions.explanation: The factors of 18 are: 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18. That's 6 factors total!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington needs to find the GCD of 20 and 30. What is it?
questions.explanation: GCD(20, 30) = 10. The factors of 20 are 1,2,4,5,10,20 and of 30 are 1,2,3,5,6,10,15,30. The largest common factor is 10!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson is investigating the LCM of 6 and 9. What is it?
questions.explanation: LCM(6, 9) = 18. The multiples of 6 are 6,12,18... and of 9 are 9,18... The smallest common multiple is 18!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is checking if 234 is divisible by 3. What is the sum of its digits?
questions.explanation: Sum of digits: 2 + 3 + 4 = 9. Since 9 is divisible by 3, so is 234!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is studying prime numbers. Which is the smallest prime number greater than 30?
questions.explanation: 31 is prime. 29 is also prime but smaller, 33 = 3Ã—11, 35 = 5Ã—7, but 31 has no divisors other than 1 and 31!

questions.question: Lady Pawsington needs to find all factors of 24. How many factors does 24 have?
questions.explanation: The factors of 24 are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. That's 8 factors total!

questions.question: Inspector Clawson is investigating the GCD of 24 and 36. What is it?
questions.explanation: GCD(24, 36) = 12. The factors of 24 are 1,2,3,4,6,8,12,24 and of 36 are 1,2,3,4,6,9,12,18,36. The largest common factor is 12!

questions.question: Professor Tinkles is calculating the LCM of 8 and 12. What is it?
questions.explanation: LCM(8, 12) = 24. The multiples of 8 are 8,16,24... and of 12 are 12,24... The smallest common multiple is 24!

questions.question: Sir Whiskersworth is checking if 456 is divisible by 4. What are the last two digits?
questions.explanation: The last two digits are 56. Since 56 is divisible by 4, so is 456!
